t: Ezekiel 32
A Lament for Pharaoh
In*p the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Son of man, lament for Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him, ‘You*pn compare yourself to a lion of the nations, but*ln you are like a monster in the seas. You*ln thrash about in your rivers, churn*ln up the waters with your feet, and*ln muddy the rivers.
“‘This*p is what the Lord God*s says: I*pn will spread my net over you with*ln an assembly of many peoples, and*ln they will haul you up in my net.

I*ln will abandon you on the land and*ln throw you onto the open field. I*ln will cause all the birds of the sky to*ln settle on you and*ln let the wild creatures of the entire earth eat*ln their fill of you.
I*ln will put your flesh on the mountains and*ln fill the valleys with your carcass.
I*ln will drench the land with*ln the flow of your blood, even*ln to the mountains; the*ln ravines will be filled with your gore.
“‘When*ln I snuff you out, I*ln will cover the heavens and*ln darken their stars. I*ln will cover the sun with a cloud, and*ln the moon will not give its light.
I*ln will darken all the shining lights in*ln the heavens over you, and*ln will bring darkness on your land. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s
“‘I*pn will trouble the hearts of many peoples, when*ln I bring about your destruction among*ln the nations, in*ln countries you have not known.

I*ln will cause many peoples to be appalled at you, and*ln their kings will shudder with fear because of you when*ln I brandish my sword in front of them. On*ln the day of your downfall each*ln of them will tremble every*ln moment for his life.
“‘For*p this is what the Lord God*s says: The*pn sword of Babylon’s king will*ln come against you!
I*ln will make your hordes fall by*ln the swords of warriors, all*ln of them ruthless men from the nations. They*ln will ravage Egypt’s pride, and*ln all its hordes will be destroyed.
I*ln will slaughter all its cattle that*ln are beside many waters. No*ln human foot will churn them again, and*ln no cattle hooves will disturb them.
Then*ln I will let their waters settle and*ln will make their rivers flow like oil. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s
When*pn I make the land of Egypt a desolation, so*ln that it is emptied of everything in it, when*ln I strike down all who live there, then*ln they will know that I am the Lord.*s
“‘The*p daughters of the nations will chant that lament. They will chant it over Egypt and all its hordes. This is the declaration of the Lord God*s .’”
Egypt in Sheol
In*p the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, wail over the hordes of Egypt and bring Egypt and the daughters of mighty nations down to the underworld, to be with those who descend to the Pit:
Who*pn do you surpass in loveliness? Go*ln down and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised!
They*ln will fall among those slain by the sword. A*ln sword is appointed! They*ln drag her and all her hordes away.
Warrior*ln leaders will speak from*ln the middle of Sheol about*ln him and his allies: ‘They*ln have come down; the*ln uncircumcised lie slain*ln by the sword.’
“Assyria*pn is there with her whole assembly; her*ln graves are all around her. All*ln of them are slain, fallen by the sword.

Her*ln graves are set in the deepest regions of the Pit, and*ln her assembly is all around her burial place. All*ln of them are slain, fallen by the sword — those*ln who once spread terror in*ln the land of the living.

“Elam*pn is there with*ln all her hordes around her grave. All*ln of them are slain, fallen by the sword — those*ln who went down to the underworld uncircumcised, who*ln once spread their terror in*ln the land of the living. They*ln bear their disgrace with*ln those who descend to the Pit.

Among*ln the slain they*ln prepare a bed for Elam with*ln all her hordes. Her*ln graves are all around her. All*ln of them are uncircumcised, slain*ln by the sword, although*ln their terror was once spread in*ln the land of the living. They*ln bear their disgrace with*ln those who descend to the Pit. They*ln are placed among the slain.

“Meshech*pn and Tubal are there, with*ln all their hordes. Their*ln graves are all around them. All*ln of them are uncircumcised, slain by the sword, although*ln their terror was once spread in*ln the land of the living.

They*ln do not lie down with*ln the fallen warriors of the uncircumcised, who*ln went down to Sheol with*ln their weapons of war, whose*ln swords were placed under their heads and*ln their shields rested*ln on their bones, although*ln the terror of these warriors was*ln once in the land of the living.
But*ln you will be shattered and*ln will lie down among the uncircumcised, with*ln those slain by the sword.

“Edom*pn is there, her kings and all her princes, who,*ln despite their strength, have been placed among*ln those slain by the sword. They*ln lie down with the uncircumcised, with*ln those who descend to the Pit.

All*ln the leaders of the north and*ln all the Sidonians are there. They*ln went down in shame with the slain, despite*ln the terror their strength inspired. They*ln lie down uncircumcised with*ln those slain by the sword. They*ln bear their disgrace with*ln those who descend to the Pit.
“Pharaoh*pn will see them and*ln be comforted over all his hordes — Pharaoh*ln and his whole army, slain*ln by the sword.” This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s

“For*pn I will spread my terror in*ln the land of the living, so*ln Pharaoh and all his hordes will*ln be laid to rest among the uncircumcised, with*ln those slain by the sword.” This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s
